summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons employee (Senior Officer Specialist at MCC New York) on July 15, 2021. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including his prior suicide attempt, cell assignments, institutional procedures, and events on August 9-10, 2019. The witness provides details about Epstein's cell mates, the July 23 suicide attempt, the process for court lists and inmate counts, and Epstein's demeanor and phone call on August 9.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at MCC New York whose death is under investigation. Discussed regarding his suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, cell assignments, interactions with staff, and phone call on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's first cell mate in Special Housing. Present during Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt. Was facing murder charges. Epstein later asked to be placed back with him after suicide watch.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate after he returned from suicide watch. Was moved out of MCC on or before August 9, 2019. Witness was not familiar with him.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate placed on dry cell in R&D on August 9, 2019, at 3:15 p.m. Mentioned in context of count procedures and movement logs.

connections.description: Were cell mates in Special Housing Unit. Tartaglione was present during Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt. Epstein later asked to be placed back with him after suicide watch but was denied.
Were cell mates after Epstein returned from suicide watch. Reyes was moved out of MCC on or before August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's first suicide attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide in his cell while cell mate Tartaglione was present. He was found with a sheet around his neck, sitting on the floor, with the sheet hooked to the bed ladder. He was breathing and received CPR.

events.title: Epstein's phone call and last interactions
events.description: On the evening of August 9, Epstein made an unmonitored phone call, which he was happy about. He interacted with staff in the elevator and was returned to his cell in Special Housing. This was the last shift before his death.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell. The witness was not working on this shift.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez placed on dry cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was placed on dry cell in R&D at 3:15 p.m. after allegedly swallowing drugs. This movement is discussed in relation to count procedures and logs.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
R&D (Receiving and Discharge) at MCC New York
Control Center at MCC New York
Attorney conference rooms at MCC New York
keyFacts: Epstein had two known cell mates: Tartaglione (first) and Efrain Reyes (second). Reyes was moved out of MCC on or before August 9, 2019.
Epstein attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, while with cell mate Tartaglione. He was found with a sheet around his neck, sitting on the floor.

After his suicide attempt, Epstein was taken off suicide watch allegedly after his lawyers contacted a judge, who then called the MCC. Epstein asked to be placed back with Tartaglione but was denied, suggesting he may have claimed Tartaglione assaulted him.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein made an unmonitored phone call, which he was happy about. The call was likely authorized by Unit Team or a supervisor.

The interview discusses potential irregularities in count slips for the SHU and R&D on August 9, including handwritten '+1' additions that the witness had never seen before and suggested may have been added after the fact.
